greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,h) = number of functions f:{1,2,...,n}->{1,2,...,n-1} such that |Image(f)|=h, h=1,2,...,n-1, n=2,3,...
formula: T(n, h) = C(n-1, h)*U(n, h), where U(n, h) is the array in A019538.
example: To see that T(4,2)=42, first count 7 functions from {1,2,3,4}
onto {1,2} with f(1)=1 and 7 with f(1)=2. Count 14 onto {1,3}
and 14 onto {2,3}, for a total of 42.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 17 2004
